data.title: The Ancient World Online: Online resources related to Nimrud
data.meta_description: [First posted on AWOL 16 April 2015, updated 3 May 2021]   Online resources related to Nimrud  a component of Oracc: The Open Richly Annotat...
data.text:
One of the Nimrud Project's aims to bring together online resources related to Nimrud. This page lists bibliographic material available online, plus web resources and other online content.

Books on Nimrud published by the British Institute for the Study of Iraq (BISI)

Articles from the BISI's journal Iraq

Articles available via JSTOR (requires subscription)

Articles available via Scopus (requires subscription)

Books available online

Web resources

Books on Nimrud published by the British Institute for the Study of Iraq

PDFs are downloadable from the BISI website; follow the links below and see the terms of use. These publications were digitised as part of the Nimrud project.

Cuneiform Texts from Nimrud (CTN)

Kinnier Wilson, J.V., The Nimrud Wine Lists (Cuneiform Texts from Nimrud, 1) 1972 (113 MB).

Postgate, J.N., The Governor's Palace Archive (Cuneiform Texts from Nimrud, 2) 1973 (175 MB).

Dalley, S.M. and J.N. Postgate, The Tablets from Fort Shalmaneser (Cuneiform Texts from Nimrud, 3) 1984 (123 MB).

Wiseman, D.J. and J.A. Black, Literary Texts from the Temple of Nabu (Cuneiform Texts from Nimrud, 4) 1996 (119 MB).

Saggs, H.W.F., The Nimrud Letters, 1952 (Cuneiform Texts from Nimrud, 5) 2001 (156 MB).

Ivories from Nimrud (IN)

Orchard, J.J., Equestrian Bridle-Harness Ornaments: Catalogue & Plates (Ivories from Nimrud, I/2), 1967 (18.1 MB).

Mallowan, M.E.L. and L.G. Davies, Ivories in the Assyrian Style (Ivories from Nimrud, II), 1970 (21.9 MB).

Mallowan, M.E.L. and G. Herrmann, Furniture from SW 7, Fort Shalmaneser (Ivories from Nimrud, III), 1974 (52.2 MB).

Herrmann, G., Ivories from Room SW 37, Fort Shalmaneser, part I (Ivories from Nimrud, IV/1), 1986 (76.3 MB).

Herrmann, G., Ivories from Room SW 37, Fort Shalmaneser, part 2 (Ivories from Nimrud, IV/2), 1986 (81.4 MB).

Herrmann, G., The Small Collections from Fort Shalmaneser (Ivories from Nimrud, V), 1992 (60.9 MB).

Herrmann, G., S. Laidlaw and H. Coffey, Ivories from the North West Palace (1845-1992) (Ivories from Nimrud, VI), 2009 (37 MB).

Herrmann, G. and S. Laidlaw, Ivories from Rooms SW11/12 and T10 Fort Shalmaneser, parts 1-2 (Ivories from Nimrud, VII), 2013 (5.7 MB).

Other publications

Curtis, J.E. (ed.), Fifty Years of Mesopotamian Discovery: The Work of the British School of Archaeology in Iraq, 1932-1982, 1982 (131 MB; includes a chapter on Nimrud).

Oates, D. and J. Oates, Nimrud: An Assyrian Imperial City Revealed, 2001 (128 MB).

Herrmann, G., S. Laidlaw and H. Coffey, The Published Ivories from Fort Shalmaneser, Nimrud, 2004 (27 MB).

Curtis, J.E. et al. (eds.), New Light on Nimrud: Proceedings of the Nimrud Conference, 11th-13th March 2002, 2008 (22 MB).

Other web resources on Nimrud (ordered alphabetically by provider)

British Museum

Palaces of Assyria, King Ashurnasirpal II's palace at Nimrud

British Museum resource from the early 2000s featuring explorable map of the Northwest Palace of Assurnasirpal II.

The Nimrud Bowls

British Museum research project examining bronze bowls from Nimrud.

Cuneiform Digital Library Initiative (CDLI)

Nimrud on CDLIwiki

Information on excavation history at Nimrud, buildings on the citadel TT mound, and the Northwest Palace.

The Northwest Palace, Nimrud

Map and information on the Northwest Palace of Assurnasirpal II.

Factum Arte

Facsimile reconstruction of the eastern end of the throne room of Ashurnasirpal II, Northwest Palace, Nimrud

Since 2010, Factum Arte together with the Factum Foundation for Digital Technology in Conservation have been running a project to create a physical reconstruction of the eastern end of Assurnasirpal II's throne room, using high resolution digital scanning to create replicas of bas-reliefs TT held in various museum collections. The project aims to display the reunited replicas in Iraq.

Learning Sites Inc.

The Central Palace of Tiglath-pileser III at Nimrud

Digital resource (created 2002) on Tiglath-pileser III's PGP Central Palace PGP , based on excavations of the site conducted by the Polish Centre of Mediterranean Archaeology between 1974 and 1976. Contains excavation photographs, site plan drawings and computer model renderings.

The Northwest Palace of Ashurnasirpal II at Nimrud

Digital resource (created 1997) on the Northwest Palace, based on excavations of the site conducted by the Polish Centre of Mediterranean Archaeology from 1974 to 1976. Contains reconstructions of the Palace and computer model renderings.

Oriental Institute of the University of Chicago

Archaeological site photographs of Nimrud

Site photographs from Nimrud taken by John and Peggy Sanders between 1973 and 1990.
